intro: Suaeda neuquenensis, commonly known as the Neuquén saltbush, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Argentina. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, salt-tolerant leaves. The plant typically grows in saline soils and is adapted to harsh, dry environments. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it plays a role in stabilizing soils in its native habitat. Suaeda neuquenensis is an important species for ecological studies in semi-arid ecosystems.
